stem: Differentiate between growth hormone disorders based on the age of onset.
template: Excessive growth hormone before the epiphyseal plates close results in {{disorder1}}, whereas the same excess in adulthood leads to enlargement of the hands, feet, and face, known as {{disorder2}}.

rationale.correct: Gigantism (Childhood/Pre-closure) = Extreme height. Acromegaly (Adulthood/Post-closure) = Thickened bones/organs (No height increase).
rationale.incorrect: Dwarfism is GH deficiency. Cushing's is too much cortisol.
clinicalPearls: Acromegaly can lead to cardiovascular disease and diabetes due to hormonal effects on metabolism.

questionTrap.howToOvercome: Once epiphyseal plates (growth plates) fuse, bones can only grow in thickness (Acro-), not length (Gigan-).
